alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Lancaster; Middlesex; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 11:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Middlesex, southeastern King and Queen, southeastern King William, southeastern Essex and west central Lancaster Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1115 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Stevensville, or near King William, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Stevensville around 1125 PM EDT. King And Queen Court House around 1135 PM EDT. West Point, Little Plymouth, Church View and Jamaica around 1200 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Laneview, Nesting, Upright, Ino, Dragonville, Walkerton, Belle Isle State Park, Montague, Rose Garden and Mattaponi. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Lancaster; Middlesex; Western King and Queen
